bug.author: vmichals
bug.summary: ASHA suggests points not contained in space
bug.description:
Describe the bug When I define the fidelity dimension as fidelity(25,1000,base=2), ASHA proposes 24 for the bottom rung. Do min_resources, max_resources have to be powers of base? Expected behavior I expected the rungs to be adjusted in some way to match the min/max resources. I don't know the algorithm well, so I might be missing something. Steps to reproduce Define a search space with fidelity(25,1000,base=2) and use ASHA Environment
OS: CentOS Linux release 7.7.1908 (Core) Python version: e.g. 3.6.9 Or√≠on version: develop Database: PickleDB
I think the rungs are computed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Epistimio/orion/blob/29c0dfc13637aa3add6a57ce585232d65afcc541/src/orion/algo/asha.py#L43>here</denchmark-link>
There seems to be a check if the last element is greater than <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Epistimio/orion/blob/29c0dfc13637aa3add6a57ce585232d65afcc541/src/orion/algo/asha.py#L52>here</denchmark-link> . Maybe one could add a similar test for the first element not being lower than .

comments.comment: Thank you for raising this issue. I'll take a look at it with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bouthilx>@bouthilx</denchmark-link> .
